Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Sung W Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Venice Beach was not what I expected it to be, although interesting nonetheless. The hotel was right on the boardwalk, maybe too accessible to the locals! The rooms all had a kitchenette with appliances included, for those traveling with families who like to cook. It wasn't an extravagant place, but perfect location for budget-minded individuals.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Doug F
Reviews.Content: the room was clean. the locations was prime. And for such a crazy area the hotel was quiet. Mat and Andy were a great resource of information. We felt very welcomed and after a couple of days it felt like home. I can't really think of anything bad or in need of improvement other than I wished the kitchen had a spatula There is one caveat: Venice Beach can be very crazy: If you're uncomfortable around the homeless and the odd nutter it's best to avoid the area.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad but if want something different when in LA”
Reviews.Author: fmkyfc
Reviews.Content: I make frequent trips to LA usually a layover on my way to Santa Barbara for meetings. Most of the time stay aorund LAX at one of those big chain hotels and they are all fine. However this time around I wanted to stay at somewhere different and near the beach. Santa Monica was the first choice but hotels there are very costly so I decided for Venice beach. The best thing about the hotel is the location. It is right on the beach front and major attractions at Venice. It is also close to Santa Monica. I chose the half seaview studio and it was ok. It had everything and the small kitchenette and utensils provide is a nice touch. The bath room is on the small side and bath amenities are basic, So best bring your own. The room was clean and bright. I had some problems with the TV though. I did not seem to get it to work. There is no car park at the hotel so you will need to park at the open car parks near by. There are a few and the charge around 20 dollars for overnight parking. A good option is you want to experience Venice Beach stay and something different. For me the room rate is on a high side for what you are getting,

Reviews.Title: “Bargain and CEntral”
Reviews.Author: moaiisle
Reviews.Content: We had a long flight from NZ and arrived to find we had been upgraded to a corner room with a view of the beach. We worried that it would be noisy as the hotel was right on the front but the boardwalk was quiet after 10. The staff were SO WONDERFUL and took us to a great restaurant; pizza place round the corner, cant remember the name but be warned the Margaritas are to die for! This was a place that is not luxury, but for the money one of the best places I have ever stayed in and I would go back again and recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but know what to expect before hand.”
Reviews.Author: itsanthonya
Reviews.Content: Here is my experience at this hotel for a two day long weekend trip. My wife and I arrived very late at night and found a letter from the staff with instructions on how to get into the hotel and our room since no one was around. So first lesson here is that the office is open only from 9am till around 8pm so if your going to arrive late make certain that you call before hand and get all the necessary info. This was an error on our part so I thought I should make that clear. If you have a car than take note that there is no hotel parking lot but there is a lot two blocks away that you can park that will charge $15 a night but if your a seasoned traveler you can find a place to park in the area around the hotel for free. The neighborhood is dark and silent at night but I felt safe in it so I'd say check in get the wife and kids situated and go park that car in the neighborhood and just walk back to your room and save yourself some cash.Now on with the review...after we got our instructions and got into the hotel the first thing we notice is the lift. Now my wife and I have stayed in several old buildings in Europe so the lift was not a shocker for us but if your used to modern places you must remember that this is a century old building and the lift was designed for this place. It is a birdcage type of lift that requires that you open the outer door then the cage. After you enter close the outer door and cage and that's it. Make certain that when you get to your floor to close the cage and the lift because if someone else wants to use the lift on another floor it will not work until you close the door so be courteous to others. Now the lift is a little bumpy so don't be alarmed by the ride because its perfectly safe. Up to this point nothing about the hotel had surprised or disappointed me until we got to our room. Now as I said it is an old building so of course the room is old but that wasn't the part I was disappointed about. We had paid a little extra for an ocean view but what we got was a parking lot view of the dingy apartments next door. You can see the ocean to the right when your in this room so I won't say that we didn't have a view of the ocean but in all honesty the only rooms with a true ocean view are the rooms at the front of the hotel and not the sides so I didn't think we should have paid extra for the "apartment" view. Ok enough with that and back to the room. The room size is fine for two travelers but I think the hotel could use updated furnishings.The floors were hard wood and the tub was the old porcelain kind with the clawed feet. Overall everything was clean and ready for us and worked as it should. There are lots of places for food and drinks nearby and a small convinence store a few blocks away so anything you need is close by. Being right on the boardwalk was very convenient for beach lovers but remember that it is non stop street noise all day so if your expecting peace and tranquility than the Venice boardwalk is not for you but if your expecting a very lively scene with a big cast of characters than you'll enjoyed it all immensely! All in all I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best location & best service”
Reviews.Author: Shanearn
Reviews.Content: OK, like everyone else has written, you can't beat the location of this hotel - it's right on the boardwalk! This means you can walk out of your hotel and straight into the action that provides Venice Beach its attraction. My wife & I stayed here for 4 nights in January and at times found ourselves just sitting at the front of the building watching all the characters passing by. There are some great characters on the boardwalk. The rooms are quite small by comparison to almost any other hotel but nontheless well appointed with complete kitchen including fridge, coffee maker, cooking facilities and even the kitchen sink. The bed was very comfortable and the room provides quite a lot of storage space for hanging-up your clothes. Be aware that this is a boutique hotel, meaning that daily room cleaning is not provided so you need to ask receiption for new towels each day. The TV was ancient but provided more channels than you will ever need. If you're watching TV you're wasting time and missing out on the real attractions of Venice Beach! Above all else, including the location, is the excellent service provided by all the staff. From the time you arrive Andy (and the rest of the staff) make you feel like you've arrived home. I can honestly state that the genuine hospitality of everyone was the most generous we have received anywhere. The hotels goal is "to exceed our guests' expectations at every opportunity", and they certainly do. It's probably the only place we've ever stayed where you feel like giving the staff a hug, not just a handshake, when leaving. This was not our first visit to Venice Beach over the years but was our first stay at this hotel. We would now not stay anywhere else in L.A. and look forward to visiting again sometime soon. We provide the highest recommendation to anyone looking to stay in L.A., and particularly the Venice Beach area.

Reviews.Title: “Unsophisticated stay in the middle of Venice beach”
Reviews.Author: ikar77
Reviews.Content: Well, the Venice Beach Suites & Hotel is definitely as simple and easygoing as the Venice beach itself. It's a good choice for students, budget travelers and for people who want to feel what the real venice beach is. You have only two choices: to love the hotel or to hate it :) The look of the Venice Beach Suites & Hotel reminds european hostels, but inside it is quite lovely hotel with vintage squeaky lift. The room is quite clean with small kitchen and additional folding bed for extra guest. It's little noisy from the beach during the night, but it's the part of the Venice beach experience stay. The staff is very kind and helpful. Hotel doesn't have own parking, so you could park the car on paid public beach parking or ask the staff to give you the map of free parking places. So in general the hotel definitely has own face and character and absolutely fit the character of the Venice beach place.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely lovely”
Reviews.Author: Jarek_Yaroslav
Reviews.Content: this is i think the 'truest' venice beach experience - the place is laid back, deprived of any sort of luxury, yet ultimately comfortable and friendly. it all starts with friendly staff who do not rush to make sure you are clear where its ok to park your car to avoid fines. and even provide you complimentary upgrade to part ocean view room. then, you continue to scary looking elevator, which with some dramatic sound delivers you to your floor. then the room, understated but comfortable, with wood floors and brick walls, nice fitted kitchen and comfortable bed. and in the morning, you look out of the window, and the palm trees and the beach say 'good morning' to you. absolutely loved this place. so laid back and relaxed. one warning though - while standard bed is nice, avoid extra rollaway bed at al costs - its absolutely not suitable for sleeping!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: hawkeyed
Reviews.Content: We stayed here back in June and this hotel - and the whole Venice experience - has stuck with me. Straight off the bat the staff were welcoming and made us laugh. There was a problem with the room we had booked so they upgraded us to a partial ocean view. The room itself was awesome, no it's not your shiny, bleached and disenfected hotel room but that's what makes this place so special. The location is unbeatable and although there is some street noise it didn't bother us at all. We came to Venice to get amongst it and this hotel is a great starting point - the staff can advise you on anything you want to know about local life. Also anyone who complains about the lift needs their head checked - coming from Australia I have only ever seen birdcage lifts in movies so I was stoked to see it and it works just fine. If I am lucky enough to get the chance I will definitely be coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Different for me but a great experience!”
Reviews.Author: Whitehorsecombat
Reviews.Content: I love history... and for me, this little hotel had serious history. I was worried at first as I really needed a good night sleep and the boardwalk seemed like it would never quiet down as it was just such as circus. A little culture shock when I first arrived ;) However, just like it was the end of the business day, everyone packed up and went home. It was kind of funny actually as I fully expected the side show to continue well into the evening but it just stopped all of a sudden. The hotel is quite old... one of the oldest structures on Venice Beach. The gentleman at the front desk had a huge amount of information about the area - he was 3rd generation Venice Beach resident. A great guy to talk to about the history of the place. Also, the hotel really embraces its roots with great historic pictures all over the hotel. Bed`s could have been better, but they weren't bad. Location was amazing! Great run on the beach in the morning! Will visit again... Thanks for the great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: sweetondean
Reviews.Content: I'm a big fan of Venice Beach and just love the area. This hotel was great as it's literally right on the boardwalk, which worked for me! I was travelling alone but felt safe as houses here. The staff were fantastic. When my room had a minor plumbing mishap they rushed to my rescue and gave me my room at a cheaper rate for my final night. I also seemed to have some wifi hic-cups and rather than blame my computer (which was probably the problem) they simply gave me the password to their office wifi so I could get on to that as it was less busy. I thought they were completely fantastic. The room was comfortable and homey and clean. I had everything I needed. They've made an attempt to funkify the bathroom and the kitchen was well stocked. I booked an Ocean Front room and had a 2nd floor perfect view of the beach. I was brilliant. To top it off they told me next time I come and stay to ensure that I tell them I am coming from Australia as they always try to organise early check in for Aussie's and Kiwi's coming straight from the plane. So there's a tip! I really loved these guys. I'll stay there again in a heartbeat, in fact I am next year! And if I could take a couple of months off and bum around, I would go and stay there and just commune with all the weird and wonderful people of Venice Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location!”
Reviews.Author: ksmith79
Reviews.Content: We spent 1 night in Venice Beach after a drive down the PCH! Venice Beach Suites & Hotel was a perfect spot to stay. We would definitely stay here again. The hotel staff is super friendly & the room was perfect. Wish we had known how wonderful it was & would have planned to stay longer. Our only regret was the uncooperative weather - it was foggy & cold. Hope to plan a trip here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fanastic Service”
Reviews.Author: Casswa78
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at Venice Beach Hotel and Suites for 4 nights. The location was fantastic and the service offered was exceptional. The room ticked all the right boxes comfortable bed, hot water and Wi-Fi. Matt went above and beyond our expectations, providing assistance with anything we needed, from where to get a cold beer to helping organise medical care. I would highly recommend the Venice Beach Hotel and Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: EzzyLuton
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights and absolutely loved it. The location was excellent, right on the boardwalk and close enough to Santa Monica to walk. The staff were brilliant, very helpful with regards to where to eat and what to do in LA and how to get about. Would definitely reccommend Venice Beach Suites and Hotel and we would stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Beach Location”
Reviews.Author: Pattienns
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel is right on the beach boardwalk in Venice. The rooms are clean and comfortable and the hotel staff is over-the-top friendly and helpful. Parking is a challenge, so be prepared to pay extra to park your car. The sidewalk vendors are a strange group and the music and activity level is high. I loved the location and beach and would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, friendly staff, non-existent parking”
Reviews.Author: CRHuntington
Reviews.Content: The rooms are beautiful, the views of the beach are great and the staff is very friendly. The kitchenette was very handy for breakfast in the morning and the living room space was comfortable with a reclining chair and couch. It felt like a bed and breakfast. The noise of the beach though is a little bit much as you're towering just above the very busy walkway. Until the beach closes down it's impossible to nap. The people talking isn't the bad part, it's the stereos and shops with music all mashed together that is a little unnerving. The parking situation is HORRIBLE. There is no parking for the hotel at all. To check in you park in a dark alley behind the hotel to drop off your things and then you have to go on an escapade searching for street parking, which in LA is almost impossible to find. I got 2 parking tickets the last time I stayed here because a parking regulation sign was missing (stolen maybe?) and the other ticket because it was dark and I was tired and I didn't go searching for the parking regulation sign that was probably at the end of the block. Expect to walk at least 6 blocks from where you end up finding parking back to the hotel and possibly getting up at dawn to move your car depending on street sweeping schedules. You won't find a spot to just park your car for the whole trip either since in LA street sweeping schedules are ridiculous so you will have to move your car at least once a day, maybe twice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice little hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Markus145
Reviews.Content: This place has to be the best deal on Venice Beach, affordable right on the beach, rooftop terrace and cool proprietor and staff. Only thing you have to be aware of is many of the rooms are small, but for the price what would you expect? But just know that I gave the rooms a 4 out of 5 just to point that out to picky people. Other thing you need to be cool with The Venice Beach scene if you stay there, but come on why else would you be staying in the middle of the strip? Girlfriend and I loved it, cozy room, perfect for guy or girl that wants their partner close.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel on our 14-day roadtrip”
Reviews.Author: k4krystal
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel in advance of our roadtrip to California. Our overall experience was fantastic; I've never received such great service from staff. The staff called us 3 days before our stay to give us some tips on parking and checking in. Once we arrived, they surprised us with a complementary upgrade to the largest room of the hotel, with the best view! The hotel is located right on the Venice Beach boardwalk, so we were able to walk everywhere. They gave us lots of dining and activity recommendations, and have beach equipment available for guests to use. Things to know about Venice Beach: The parking situation is a little inconvenient, no matter where you stay. The boardwalk is bustling all day, and has some loud wanderers at night; don't expect peace and quiet here!

Reviews.Title: “Most friendly staff ever!”
Reviews.Author: 560Ang_lique_H560
Reviews.Content: I've been in LA many, may times in the past 10 years and stayed in a variety of hotels- from low budget to five star hotels. But this is absolutely one of my favorite places I've been so far. You can really feel the owners put a lot of effort to preserve the building's history. The location is great, the place is spotless clean, loved the fact that the hotel provides surf boards, body boards and a 2 dollar laundry service. And then there was the staff. Everybody who works here, is so friendly and helpful. I will definitely come back here!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: claire87_11
Reviews.Content: We booked an ocean room view and were not disappointed! Room was spacious for the three of us although the bathroom was very small!. Room was cleaned on a daily basis with clean towels supplied. The hotel itself is very clean, taking the location into consideration, I had expected sand to be everywhere but was pleasantly suprised! The staff were so friendly and helpful and really went out of there way to accomodate our needs, they really added to the overall athmosphere of the place and made us feel so welcomed. The hotel is central and overlooks the beach. The only bad thing is,it can be very difficult to find the place by taxi/car as it is down side streets so be sure to have the address on you at night! I would highly recommend this hotel, its more like a four star than a two star. Very happy guest!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, good value, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: DigTravelMd
Reviews.Content: We decide to head back to LA area one day early and looked online for a hotel in Santa Monica area for one night - way too expensive for hotels with bad reviews. Found this hotel next beach over for a reasonable rate and it says it is right on the boardwalk. I have to say, when we first arrived I was a little worry/uncomfortable - graffiti, tatoos place, punk kids, hippies. The neighorhood feel is totally different than Santa Monica. But soon you learn this "is" Venice Beach. Read HillPill's review on June 20, 2011 for a good description of the hotel and what Venice Beach area is about. (In short: as HillPill said: "if the idea of anything other than boring whitebread suburbia makes you nervous, you need to stay in Santa Monica or Marina Del Rey." summed it up.) It is not for everyone, but it can be a unique experience. The location is great! Right on Boardwalk. Many conveniences - restaurants right next door, shops, performers. Walking around Venice beach you find it is such an active place! basketball courts, skateboard park, outdoor gym, 'tennis looking' paddle sport, sand volleyball nets, bike paths! Beautiful beach right out front, for sunbathing, surfing and swimming. (looks like the hotel have some equipment you can borrow as well.) Staff: We only talked to and dealt with Lewis and he was great and very friendly. In Summary: It is not a fancy place, small (bathroom very small), old, but clean, well equipped (microwave, stove, frig), great location for the beach and many conveniences near by and with a helpful/friendly staff. No A/C but it was comfortable for us in mid July. Parking is difficult during the day, but there are plenty to do within walking distant. You can plan your stay to go to places that you need to drive and coming back around 6-ish when the day tourists are leaving and you should be able to find free street parking for the night. We came for the beach and it was wonderful location and got a unique experience on top of that. It was fun walking around, listened to performers and people watching.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back!!!”
Reviews.Author: Honeyman1
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 great nights at the Venice Beach Suites & Hotel. It's in the middle of Venice Beach, right on the Boardwalk. If you want to be where the action is.......this is the place. The office staff were not like the people that work at the big hotels...they were amazingly helpful with any issue we asked them about.....from rental cars to restaurant recommendations. They made sure that all of our needs were met...and they did it with a smile on their face. The room we had was kind of small...but we were hardly ever there. The hotel is older, but it is very clean and well maintained. Venice is a crazy place.....a great place to people-watch. If we return to the Venice Beach area, we would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel on Venice Beach”
Reviews.Author: HillPill
Reviews.Content: Located right in the crazy mix of Venice Beach, the Venice Beach Suites and Hotel is a charming boutique hotel. The rooms were adequately equipped and clean. Each room has one queen bed with a rollaway bed offered. Satellite TV was available as well. The room we stayed in had a small kitchen area with a stove, microwave, and refrigerator. I loved the hardwood floors and ceiling fan. Yes, there are no a/c units. But you don't need an a/c unit most days in So. Cal. Yes, the building is old. It is what it is. The rooms are not big and there are brick walls. But what do you expect from a building from the early 20th century? There is no parking lot, but they have a parking agreement with a lot about two short blocks away. Not a big deal. In fact, the gentleman at the front desk walked down to the lot to make sure everything was okay. About the neighborhood: If you get uncomfortable around any type of counter-culture, you won't like Venice Beach. Venice Beach is wacky. It is busy. There are hippies and bums and punk kids and freaks and weirdos around the boardwalk and side streets. But most are harmless. People do party on the weekends, so yes, there might be some noise coming from outside. Still, if the idea of anything other than boring whitebread suburbia makes you nervous, you need to stay in Santa Monica or Marina Del Rey. Just expect to pay more. The staff was extremely nice and helpful. I can't say enough good things about they way everyone treated us. They offered to help us with our bags, gave us a map of the area, and recommended places to eat. It was quite refreshing. Overall, I would stay here again and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly & very Helpful”
Reviews.Author: TravelinBiker67
Reviews.Content: The hotel is old, but very clean. Everyone on the staff goes out of there way to make sure you enjoy your stay. If you are the type of person that needs a pool, hot-tub suites, & room service this might not be the place for you. If ya like a good, clean, friendly, place to lay your head at night I recommend Venice Beach Hotel & Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Boyds_TSB
Reviews.Content: As Andy points out below, they arent the Best Western or Motel 6. We werent expecting to be dazzled by chic modern decor and corporate staff. What we got instead was a clean comfortable room with the added benefit of having a kitchenette. Being right on the boardwalk of Venice had its good points and bad points. The bad was that if someone in the apartments nearby is having a party then you may find it hard to get a great nights sleep. The good point is obviously you step out of the hotel right in the thick of Venice boardwalk...five steps and you're in sand. Staff were incredibly helpful and happy to offer their local expertise in any way possible. Great value for money and incredible location. My wife is a fascist when it comes to hotels and normally books Novotels and Sofitels, even she loved this place...will stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for the Venice Beach experience!”
Reviews.Author: Boatman1963
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the center of Venice Beach and for that reason, its a great pick if thats the environment you like. Street vendors, great people watching, good food, excellent beaches, etc. Matt at the Venice Beach Suites was helpfull and fun to talk too. The room was clean and nicely maintained and what a beautiful view! Venice Beach may not be for everyone, but we will return again sometime soon. Due to all the activity outside, its not a quiet location during the day, but then again, if you are looking for that, you would not be considering Venice Beach would you?

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: snoww14
Reviews.Content: Elevator dangerous, room has no heat, telephone. Hotel has no parking. Only parking lot cost $15 and is 3 blocks away. At night you will not feel safe walking those 3 blocks as it is not a nice neighborhood. Hot water takes at least 5 minutes to get warm on the 4 floor as we were told the heater is in the basement. The bathroom is tiny and not well maintained. The only good thing about this hotel is that it is right on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like home”
Reviews.Author: jengonzales2003
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel was so amazing and friendly that they made the hotel feel like home. It was extremely clean. They had fridge, stove,and utensils. The hotel is older so it takes a little bit for the shower to heat up. But that was so minor. The staff are very informative. Their recommendations were spot on. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Back to the 1960's...”
Reviews.Author: CatherineRCalgary
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a 105 year old building whose front door opens onto the boardwalk at Venice Beach. When the shuttle drove up an alley to the back door of the hotel, I began to wonder if this was a good place to bring my teenage daughter. But the hotel was quaint and clean inside, and the people running it were very friendly and helpful. Our room was on the second floor. Our room had three windows, a kitchen, a bathroom, a double bed and a folding bed for my daughter. We had free satellite TV, Wireless internet, and local phone calls. The hotel itself was quiet. The people outside the hotel were not so quiet at night. The Venice Beach boardwalk was a bit of a gong show. Tattoo parlours, medical marijuana shops, homeless people, artists, musicians, dancers, drummers......Initially I just wanted to cancel my reservation and go somewhere else. But, we stayed and actually had a good time. We cycled along the bike paths, people watched, did a little shopping, lazed on the beach, drank fruit smoothies and gradually got into a more bohemian mind frame. By the time our weekend was over, I was sad to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Well, it was nice, but ...”
Reviews.Author: coach_pilot
Reviews.Content: ... a bit expensive. OK, the location is best situated, directly at the beach. But for a room with waterfront view in a hotel without own restaurant or breakfast, without own parking space, with a sometimes dubious nightly neighborhood, a price of far more than 200 bucks is too high. OK, I paid it, but I expected more. On the other hand Andy, the owner, is a friendly guy that gives you advise in any case. And to save money you can book another room fora lower price.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in Venice & LA!”
Reviews.Author: davetuckett
Reviews.Content: The hotel is literally on the boardwalk! Overlooking the famous Venice Beach. You could not be any closer without getting wet!! It is located right in the heart of Venice Beach. Street performers and stallholders perform outside your window. This however is not obtrusive as it only takes place during "office hours". We were just yards from the famous "Muscle beach" and Bodybuilding "Pen"! We could see all the action from our window. "Speedway" runs the length of the beach giving vehicular access to the rear of the hotel. There was no long stay parking on site but parking on the streets nearby was convenient and free, with very helpful advice and a map provided by the hotel staff. The hotel is old and not what you may be used to if you stay regularly at large upmarket places. However we had just been on a 5 star cruise and stayed for 4 days at a very upmarket Vegas Suite and in comparison the Venice Beach Hotel was perfectly satisfactory! It was clean and offered everything that we needed. The rooms were spacious and offered "efficiencies" (fully equiped kitchen). They were in fact mini suites or "condos". The bedroom was spacious with a comfortable bed, good lighting and effective window blinds as well as plenty of closet (wardrobe) storage space and furniture. There was a ceiling fan and tv with dvd player and free local call telephone. Also complimentary (100% free wi-fi Internet access). The kitchen had microwave, fridge, cooker, etc and a dining table. The bathroom was spacious. Staff were very helpful and courteous, helping to plan days out and offering us maps etc. Venice is a wonderful place to spend a vacation but it is also ideally located for all of LA! Just minutes from LAX airport and easy to find if you are driving. Very close to Santa Monica and handy for Hollywood and downtown. It is safe and relatively inexpensive. Venice itself offers the legendary beach, with nice sands and surf. The amazing entertainmant of the boardwalk performers and vendors as well as all the history and canals. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again next time we visit LA! Highly recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “Experience Venice Beacn”
Reviews.Author: LionelDurant
Reviews.Content: I had an excellent experience during my stay in Los Angeles when I stayed here. The Staff wee all very helpful and pleasant. I found the rooms to be a vey good value. The Fact that the hotel is upgrading their facilities is very good for the future. they are a thriving family owned and operated operation and that fact shines thru in their focus on customer service. I will highly recommend them to people traveling to L.A.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for beach-front accommodations”
Reviews.Author: dtreat2mars
Reviews.Content: We were in town for a wedding, and chose the Venice Beach Suites & Hotel based on price and location. What a great find. Although not superior in features compared to pricier properties, this hotel can't be beat for price and location. The room, a suite, was comfortable and provided appropriate amenities at this price point. Service was overall fantastic - very friendly and accommodating of our late check-in. Parking in the area can be a challenge if you have a rental car, but is doable. For a literal beach-front property, it certainly satisfies and we were very happy.

Reviews.Title: “This was the friendliest and best hotel staff I've ever known.”
Reviews.Author: Badgirart
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 8 nights with my friend. We both loved everything about this hotel but mostly the people working here. They are so welcoming and helpful and friendly. The room was inviting with exposed brick and a kitchenette. It was clean enough for the fact that this is an older structure built in about 1912 and renovated by the current owner. I much prefer it over a new hotel. Venice Beach is known for its funky appeal and this place fits right in. The location can't be beat. You walk out the door and you are right on the boardwalk in the midst of a carnival of life and looking across the way to one of the most beautiful beaches in the country. It's wide with palm trees and a gently curving bike path. I love all the diversity of Venice Beach and all the characters you meet. There is no other place like it. If you like theater and people watching and getting out of your comfort zone, this is the place for you. Thank you so much to Andy, Matt, Lewis, and Tom of the Venice Beach Suites and Hotel for making our stay such a memorable one. I look forward to seeing you again next year. Keithley I can't wait to come back to Venice Beach and I wouldn't consider staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and location right on beach in heart of Venice Beach”
Reviews.Author: ggrannyd
Reviews.Content: reasonably priced and great location. An older hotel and not the swankiest place, this hotel offers a homey feel and has a wonderful and accommodating staff. Right in the heart of Venice Beach it offers fabulous views, many great restaurants and interesting neighborhoods within walking distance, Bus service is also easy and convenient to beaches both north and south. The street life amazing and interesting. Not yet gentrified and boring, the world outside this hotel truly represents the freedom of expression that makes the USA so great.

Reviews.Title: “Dont touch anything you dont know what you might catch!!”
Reviews.Author: MrsB2BPortsmouth
Reviews.Content: Booked here for 2 nights as a base for visiting LA. We paid $268 for 2 nights. Well, we stayed for one then got the hell out of there!! What a dive!! Suspicious stains on the chair, no house keeping unless you were staying at least 7 nights, old fashioned, questionable bed linen - we stripped the bed before daring to sleep on it! Bathroom so small you could shower whilst brushing your teeth! Drawers thar nearly fell apart when you opened them - we refused to even unpack! Filthy window blinds that barely worked. We stayed for the one night and decided to drive back to Vegas rather then stay the 2nd night as it was just horrible. If we had only paid a small amount to be there then we wouldnt moan but no way is it worth the money we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy but conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: ashjanbar
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Venice Beach Suites and Hotels for three nights for a getaway with my fiancé I expected a whole lot more out of this hotel. As far as the room went I thought it was really outdated the comforter on the bed was faded and had stains all over it like it had never been washed I just threw it on the floor and refused to touch it our entire stay. The bathroom was tiny and there was also mold all over the shower. It was pretty dusty in the room and there wasn’t any air conditioning available only fans and small heaters. Housekeeping looked a little “suspect” to me, they weren’t even wearing uniforms and this bothered me a little so I chose not to have the room serviced. The parking is horrible and the designated parking lot for the hotel is more than two blocks away and 20.00 a night and if you are planning on parking there during the day forget about it because its not available because the hotel also offers ther parking lot to the public and its completely full during the day until about 6:00pm you are better off parking publicly for free. Don’t walk alone at night there are some shady characters around this hotel as well. The location is conveniently located on the boardwalk and the beach; this was the “only advantage” to Venice Beach and Suites hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Beat the Location”
Reviews.Author: ntz4bbl
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at the Venice Beach Suites and Hotel. First, you can't beat the location. You step out the front door onto the boardwalk. Check-in went very smoothly. We were called in advance to see what time we were arriving and I was able to get information regarding parking and the current weather. The room was small but had all the advertised amenities including a fully appointed kitchenette. Extra bedding was available in the closet including pillows, blanket, and a roll-away cot. The rooms have free wi-fi. I would recommend it for anyone wanting to stay overnight at Venice Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed experience”
Reviews.Author: MikaelK_benhavn
Reviews.Content: Room/hotel: We are a family of four - but the children is grown up, so really 4 adults. The ocean front suites - which is said to accomodate 5 persons - are really small. The sofa bed is awfull, and the big bed can't even stay out in the room, but is directly to the wall to be able to come round. So don't beleave the pictures - our suite didn't look at all like on the hotel web-page. Maybe on the other side of the stair-case - but they should have reserved one of the big suites for 4 adults - in the others there were mainly only two persons. By the way: The internet only works in certain areas - not very much in the room. Venice Beach: At daytime a nice place with a lot of energy. But around 7 pm everything close and at 9 pm only the freaks are back. We had read that the area was not save at night, but thought that night were after midnight. But we didn't know the area became empty also in the evening. So even though there are probably nothing to be afraid of it is not so nice after 9 when there is noboby there. Remeber to take warm clothes: In the evening it gets really cold and foggy even in july/august. Parking: You pay for parking at a parking lot. Just be aware, that even though you have paid for three days - if you leave in the morning and return later the same day there will probably not be room for you. Staff: The staff was extremly nice and helpfull. It was a pleasure. For instance they made on line check in on the office computer.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: liawim
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really right on the beach, with the ocean front walk just outside the door. The staff was really friendly and helpful, and we appreciated having a kitchenette in our room. There was some strange smell in our room, but besides this it's a great place to stay when you travel on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: walker42
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay here especially as it started out with a particularly nice welcome from, I believe, Matt right after we got in from a grueling trans-Pacific flight. I can't say enough nice things about all the helpful staff we encountered - really an exceptionally friendly and welcoming place. The rooms are nicely done up and I loved walking from our quiet, peaceful room out the front door of the hotel straight into the enjoyable chaos of Venice Beach. There were a few imperfections which I mention only because I would hate someone to come expecting something different and be disappointed. It is a funky old building on the beach so not everything is perfect. Our room was quite small although the attached kitchenette kept it from feeling claustrophobic. The bathroom was very small and had some odd dark corners that I wasn't totally convinced were sparkling clean although it's hard to tell sometimes with old buildings. The carpet was stained and a little grungy looking (it's on the beach after all) although everything above that looked newly painted and the furniture was great - I thought the arm chair was amazingly comfortable for a hotel room. The only other less than wonderful thing was that although we couldn't hear anything from the beach side at night there were people making noise in the street behind the hotel which woke us up. But it didn't last long. None of the slight imperfections would keep me from staying here again. The price was very reasonable, the location wonderful, and the staff was fantastic. I really enjoyed my stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms were big but the bathroom is very...”
Reviews.Author: Freq_traveller10
Reviews.Content: Rooms were big but the bathroom is very tiny. Shower curtain was covered in scum and mould. Aside from the bathroom, the staff in the hotel/motel are fantastic. Very helpful and friendly, definately redeemed the quality of this place. If cleaniness if high on your priority, this is probably not the place. But if you're a backpacker who isn't too fussed and wants to be close to the beach, then this is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel ~ Loved the Staff ~ What a GREAT vacation!!”
Reviews.Author: serrie
Reviews.Content: Thank you to all the staff at the Venice Beach Suites & Hotel - Lewis, Matt & Jude.. you guys were AWESOME!! We loved this trip & cannot stop talking about it.... what an adventure to say the least. I would recommend this hotel to anyone that wants the true Venice Beach experience. If you want all the bells & whistles - stay somewhere else.. I would recommend renting bikes... we biked up to the Santa Monica Pier daily; MUST see the canals - what a hidden treasure!! Go to Jay's Bike's & tell Patrick we said hello :) This hotel is in the middle of all the action.. steps from the sand.. and connected to the hotel is a Greek, Sushi, & Indian take-out! What more can one ask for? Loved! Loved!! LOVED this hotel!!! Cannot wait to stay again :) - "the crashes" 6/12-6/19/2010

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay by the beach”
Reviews.Author: KatyerFin
Reviews.Content: Great location by the beach! Just a few minutes walk from Santa Monica. We had a pleasant stay here. The room was clean and spacious. We had a nice view to the ocean and small kitchenette. In the evenings there are some noices outside which worried me at first, but they quit playing music early in the evening so no problem sleeping. The staff was kind and helpful. I understood there is no parking but it wasn't a problem for us at all. Free wi-fi. There are quite many restaurants near the hotel and next door. The location is perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty - nice staff”
Reviews.Author: mydoodlespace
Reviews.Content: The room was dirty and smelled of mold. The area did not feel safe at night, and homeless persons were asleep about the outer doorsteps throughout the night and into the morning. It's not bad for the young "hippie" (and I mean no condescension as I am at heart still a hippie) ... but for those wanting nice hotel accomodations, this is not the place.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Beach Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveler0088
Reviews.Content: The Venice Beach Suites and Hotel could not be in a better spot! It is literally on the boardwalk of Venice Beach, and mere steps away from the sand. We were travelling on a budget, so we were trying to get a vacation feel (aka not an airport hotel...) for less money. This hotel is not the four seasons, but it was perfect for our purposes. It was clean, and we felt safe. The room we stayed in had a little kitchen with 2 burners, a sink, a fridge, a coffeemaker and a microwave. We didn't try the burners, but the fridge, microwave, and coffeemaker all worked fine. All the provided dishes, glasses and silverware were clean and in great condition. They don't provide daily maid service automatically, but the service is available if you ask for it, (we didn't use it, we had no problem re-using our towels and sheets for 2 nights! Live green!) The staff was absolutely wonderful - everyone that we dealt with there was friendly, helpful, eager to please, and very knowledgable about the neighborhood, restaurants, transportation, etc. They accomodated us whenever we had a special request with no grumbling and no extra charges (for example, when we got there hours before check-in, they watched our bags in the office and called us on our cell phone as soon as a room was ready, and then checked us in ASAP). Again on departure, we had a gap between check-out time and our flight, so they cheerfully watched our baggage for us again so we could spend a little more time on the beach. They have discount cards for the famous Sidewalk Cafe (also steps away from the hotel) - a small thing, but a nice bonus, and we ate there twice on our 3-day trip. The hotel is within walking distance of the Santa Monica Pier, and of course, being on the boardwalk, there is great shopping, people watching, and food all around. We enjoyed our time there greatly - it was a fun hotel with a great "Venice Beach" experience. We have already recommended it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation Ever”
Reviews.Author: starlecky
Reviews.Content: If/When we ever visit LA again this is where we will be staying-no doubt about it. It starts with the staff being so helpful and going above and beyond to help their guests. The hotel was clean and at the beach it is very hard to keep sand off the floor, so it was expected. We stayed for 5 nights and had our room cleaned 1/2 way thru the stay, including linens changed. You walk out the front door and there you are right in the middle of everything, from the interesting characters in Venice, to the shops, to the gorgeous palm trees and the ocean breeze. The oceanfront pretty much closes at night, but you can sit on the porch and take in the air and still have plenty of entertainment. I traveled with my husband, two kids, 21 and 19 and my 2 yr. old grandson and this place offered something for everyone! Thank you Venice Beach Suites for making our first trip to LA so great.

Reviews.Title: “Our Ocean View Suite incident/experience”
Reviews.Author: foxman2004
Reviews.Content: "To the Manager, My partner and I stayed in your ocean front room January 1-4, 2010. I wanted to inform you of our dissatisfaction with the room we rented. The positives: The room was spacious and had a wonderful view of the ocean. The bathroom worked well, with a nice shower. The TV and the refridgerator were working. Our complaints stem from the facts which I will list: 1. I was charged over $700 for the three-night stay. 2. We had no parking at the lot I understood was used by your hotel for sending customers to; we were bluntly told, "I have no parking for you. Come back in an hour." This was after traveling from Sacramento from the airport to check into a hotel. Come back in an hour? That was ridiculous. Needless to say, with the guy's attitude and smug arrogance, I didn't give him a dime, during our stay, for parking when there was room. I parked at the lot adjacent to it. 3. There was not a system for garbage disposal, despite there being a kitchenette. We had to call for our garbage to be taken out. 4. The burners did not work on the stove. 5. The water glasses had a rank odor from being left on a rubber mat for so long, they took on the mat's smell. 6. Our room's floor was covered with sand and being there was no maid service the entire time we were there, stayed there until I used a hand towel to mop with (there was no broom or mop available.) We only strolled briefly on the beach and there wasn't sand on our shoes. 7. We had to call for new towels, washcloths for each day we stayed there. We are clean people and we bathe every day. We expected to have daily bath linens provided without having to call for them. 8. The venetian blind on the ocean-vew window would not close completely to allow sleeping in without bright sunshine. I had to insist the caretaker fix it, based on the cost of the room, because he originally told me that was the way it was. 9. Frankly, I am amazed you are still in business, because, we have stayed in Motel 6 hotels, and other economy motels and they provide daily maid service. And, I haven't paid over $700 to stay in their room! I have not recommended your hotel to anyone who asks, unless they do not care about no maid service and a minimum of services provided. Unless there are drastic changes to the way you run your hotel, we will not stay at your hotel again and I no longer want your advertisements. Sincerely, Richard A Fox

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING VALUE! I've paid this much to stay in dingy Culver City”
Reviews.Author: VWlivingthedream
Reviews.Content: So it's true that hotels cost more based on location...but I would much rather pay the $99 to stay here than the $85 to stay at some Motel 8 that is ten miles inland. This place is steps from the sand! We woke up every morning to have coffee on the BEACH. I went with some girlfriends and we had wine on the balcony and watched the California sunset more than once. I loved the all white bedding and glass door showers...feels kinda European or something. A fun and funky lounge area in the lobby too...pool table, vending machines, etc. Wish they had a microwave down there, but with so many food choices right out your front door you rarely wanted to eat in your room anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, location and service!”
Reviews.Author: annalovestotravel
Reviews.Content: It was great to arrive at Venice Beach Suites, and find our room looked just as it appeared in the advertising, had character, space and a fully functioning kitchenette! Hotel proprieter and staff bent over backwards to be helpful and make our stay pleasant and easy. I loved the location too, all the market stalls and cool and eccentric people! Great coffee at the Coffee Ginder across the road and some good little places to eat closeby. And Venice Beach is a beautiful beach! It is close to Santa Monica and you can get pretty much anywhere by bus. I really enjoyed seeing the working canals - for which Venice Beach - are named for closeby. Very charming! Don't miss the Getty museum/s and La Brea tarpits - fascinating prehistoric archaeological site right in the middle of LA!! Farmer's market also fun and lots of food stalls to choose from!

Reviews.Title: “Right in the heart of Californian Bohemia...”
Reviews.Author: dopic
Reviews.Content: Recently spent the best part of two weeks here and have to say that it was good value and a great location. Rooms were perfectly adequate for our purposes and the staff were great. Very helpful and friendly, and the beach toys and other stuff was well appreciated, especially by my youngest boy, who also loved the old style elevator. While it may not be a luxury hotel, it is just the job if you really just want somewhere to have as your base, and with all the attractions that SoCal & LA has, then you probably won't be spending too much time in there anyway! Area was surprisingly quiet at night, far enough away from any bars or restaurants, but if you wanted to head out for a few beers, then they were only just up the road. thoroughly enjoyed staying there and would recommend it. The sheer diversity of folks who hang out there was great to witness too, with even the hobos being polite and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Historic Venice location soon to be a historic landmark”
Reviews.Author: oiden
Reviews.Content: I've been to Venice numerous times, and have watched this historic building grow into a restored historic landmark once the new owner took over and began renovations several years ago. The rooms are spacious with all the modern comforts (and a full kitchenette), yet retain the feeling that you are staying in a very old establishment with the exposed brick and vintage photos on the walls. This building is apparent in all the old Muscle Beach pictures from the 1920s onward to the 1950s heyday. The owner is very friendly, conversational, and went above and beyond when I needed help to save some travel time. And the beach front location is right there in the middle of it all, walk to the canals, the piers, even the shuttle to Santa Monica. This is your best bet, for a real piece of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “You have to love it for what and where it is.”
Reviews.Author: cncmelton
Reviews.Content: This is a great place if you want to be part of the Venice Beach boardwalk lifestyle. If you want some kind of 5 star place, then pony up the extra $$$ and go there but for my money, this was well worth it. The staff was extremely helpful and took care of anything that I had any problems with. Groundworks coffee shop is just around the corner, lots of food to be had, and the accommodations fit what I needed - a place to just relax, walk out of my room and go swim in the ocean and lots of the LA/California lifestyle surrounding you.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite Venice Beach experience”
Reviews.Author: happyhippielife
Reviews.Content: I go to Venice Beach 4-5 times a year and this was my favorite place of all time to stay. You are literally right on the boardwalk! You have an AMAZING view of the ocean and everything going on. The historic hotel and rooms have so much character. I loved the huge windows, wood floors and brick walls. If you are going for a vacation, I would recommend it for sure.

Reviews.Title: “I found the Southern California lifestyle getaway.”
Reviews.Author: nikitubbs
Reviews.Content: My husband and I REALLY needed to get away -- to a beach getaway. Here, we felt like we had found it. We really didn't want to travel around. We wanted to stay right there as everything is there -- the sand, the surf, the boardwalk -- just steps outside your door, as if it were our own place. You can walk to great restaurants (the staff helps you with recommendations), lie on the beach, bike or walk easily anywhere, get caught up in the "scene" if you want -- or not at all if you don't want. It reminds me of hotels in Europe -- historic, intimate, with great service from the staff (although you feel like they're friends rather than staff), small rooms but very clean, and, of course --- you're right on the beach!!! It may be value priced, but of GREAT VALUE.

Reviews.Title: “Venice Beach ocean walk,WOW!”
Reviews.Author: RICKNER
Reviews.Content: cool place ,nice people..we enjoyed our stay on the beach and all the arts and freaks on the ocean walk.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money you pay for it”
Reviews.Author: AucklandTravelchicky
Reviews.Content: Calling it 'Suites and Hotel' makes it sound like a 4 star, when I'd probably only rate it a 1 or 2 star property. Our room had not been dusted for what looked like weeks on end. A light did not work, the wardrobe door was broken, the kitchenette was also dirty and the shower left alot to be desired. I also found it odd that there was no soap provided. Security also seemed to be an issue as we found a random guy asleep on level 2 one morning (and he was NOT a guest that forgot his key!). The location is fine if you have your ear plugs at night as there is alot of noise and no air cond or double glazing. The only thing we liked was the good service from the two guys working there, as they were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Location is about the only thing going for this place”
Reviews.Author: CamUKtraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights here and frankly, weren't that impressed. It is in a great location and you can find free parking if you're prepared to drive around for a while and then walk for 15 minutes back to the hotel! We had trouble finding anyone to check in but once we did he was very friendly and helpful. We had a beach view which gave us something to look at while we were manually filling the toilet cistern every time we wanted to flush it!!!! Luckily the cupboard that held the toilet was close to the kitchen and within turning distance of the sink! Room not very clean and we booked a twin and got a double. Not a place for families. Nowhere within walking distance for breakfast - don't go to the sidewalk cafe, food is inedible. And we certainly could not have cooked in the room...unless you like breakfast in bed! Good location for getting into LA and handy for the airport. Don't get there on a hot sunny weekend, mid-afternoon - lots of crazies! Great Sushi restaurant on the roundabout (!) near the Venice lights sign. Sit at the bar and get them to recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mscott0761
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here a couple of times already, and will continue to do so everytime we come to Venice Beach. The rooms are clean, the location is right on the beach (no shoes required!), and there are kitchens in the rooms (with dishes included). So.. pack a cooler of groceries and hole up on the beach! Pay the money for an ocean view.... it's TOTALLY worth it.... you won't have to fight the tourist crowd... you won't even have to leave your room! This is a great place to stay!!

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: MsCaliforniaRed
Reviews.Content: First time staying at Venice Beach and this place was great. The hotel was right on the pedestrian walk that borders the beach. You can’t get any closer! The front door is nestled between 2 shops which at first concerned me, but they closed by 6pm so this was no problem. Since the hotel is right on the beach parking is available a block or two away, but this wasn’t a problem either, because the nice guy who checked us in gladly volunteered to walk to our car to get our bags. Even though our room was only on the 3rd floor, my daughter loved the old-fashion elevator with the manual cage-like door. Our room had a lovely exposed brick wall and a great view of the ocean. I wish we had stayed longer at Venice Beach than at Disneyland!

Reviews.Title: “Great Time in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: ariel_lh
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. Perfect location right in the middle of everything. The staff was incredibly friendly and very helpful. The accommodations were very cute and comfortable. My only complain would be was that the sheets were that the over sheets were kind of sandy.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect and charming and exactly what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: hopsingprd
Reviews.Content: We live in L.A. and spent a day here before some surfing lessons in Santa Monica - from the moment we arrived we were treated so well that it cast a pleasant glow over the whole two days. We took a room on the second floor with the full ocean view and loved hearing the hustle and bustle outside all day - the crash of waves and occasional conversation or saxophone at night - it was just awesome in every way. We are totally going back again, just to add a little something wonderful to the weekend. GREAT managers, clean rooms that felt like a perfect apartment, and an incredibly reasonable price for being 10 feet from the beach. Parking was close by and not a problem at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time With My Son”
Reviews.Author: jewelcat57
Reviews.Content: I know I am a little late writing this review. I just want to say that this hotel has the best staff ever!! They gave us bus routes, told us of fun things to do in thre area. My son had the best time ever. This is very different than the area of the east coast we live in--it's very laid back and relaxed. My son is still talking about it and now wants to go back----without me!

Reviews.Title: “great room, great management”
Reviews.Author: cbuchman
Reviews.Content: the management was helpful, hip, and friendly from the time we booked...and especially on the phone trying to find the hotel. we were lucky and got upgraded to the corner ocean front room; This was a great room and felt like a city loft apartment on the beach. You could watch all the colorful street life of jewelry vendors , skaters, etc., on the beach below...the neighborhood is urban venice beach style (very eclectic), and no problem, ithe hotel is right in the heart of things. Although there is a parking fee there is plenty of street parking for free which the management kindly tells you their secrets on, and we walked to and from our car night and morning no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Loud, loud, loud & unsafe neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: SanchoBelgium
Reviews.Content: As soon as we arrived we felt uneasy. The location was OK: it is right on the beach. Downside: you would have to pass about 10 weirdos to get there. Let's say you do not feel comfortable walking there after dark. In the hotel we had to wait for at least 5 minutes because the receptionist was 'on the phone with a client' (which by the sound of it was more likely his girlfriend/fling than a client). The room itself was quite clean. A bottle of wine was waiting for us, very considerate. However, we were on the first floor in the back, close to the 'emergency exit' that turned out to be more of a very loud & regular exit than anything else. Being on the first floor also meant we had upstairs neighbours. And it was hell. Hardly closed an eye during the 2 nights we were there. We could hear every move on the wooden floor upstairs. We had to sleep with ear plugs. I guess for us this was not the best place to stay (Venice itself turned out not to be a very 'romantic' place). However, it is right next to Santa Monica, about a 10 minutes walk away. As soon as we set foot there, we found what we were looking for: peace & quiet & a safe feeling...

Reviews.Title: “Felt Like Home”
Reviews.Author: pepperminttulip
Reviews.Content: I've never written one of these before but felt compelled to after my stay here. I have never made to feel so welcome and comfortable in a hotel before. The hotel is wonderfully located right on the beach with many cafes and shops close by. There is so much to do and see within minutes walk. The rooms are very homey with wood floors and brick walls, and also a small kitchen. What makes this hotel rate above others is the wonderful staff. They are certainly the most accomodating folks, nothing is too much bother for them. I've read some of the drawbacks others had to say and there are valid points made. Venice is not for everyone, you'll need to open your mind to be fully rewarded with what it has to offer. As far as the hotel itself, it is an older building, the bathrooms are on the small side. I rented a car for just a couple of days and they do not have parking although this is really not a problem as there is plenty of street spaces close by. The hallways do look rather dreary and the towels and sheets could use an upgrade. I will never forget the time I spent here and look forward to returning soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: kfed567
Reviews.Content: I put my parents up here after having to move them from another hotel in the area. The hotel was very busy it being the middle of summer but the gentleman in the office (Tommy) went out of his way to take care of my parents spending a lot of time with them explaining the area, where to go, where not to go, how to get around. I travel quite a bit my self and was truly impressed by the level of quality service. He really made my parents feel comfortable away from home. They had a wonderful time and now can't wait to come back again. Thank You

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean but loud, and overrated and overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: kimparklee
Reviews.Content: We went to this place due to the good reviews. Overall, the best part is the location if you want to be right in the middle of Venice, and they are friendly but it has problems. There is really no parking. The hallways and overall feel are that of a transient hotel. The room is clean and orderly. But it is very noisy due to the location, and the blinds really dont block out much light. This is a great place if you are young and dont sleep much. Honestly, not a bad place but not great for close to $200 per night, probably ok at half that price.

Reviews.Title: “What a Treat!”
Reviews.Author: AtHomeInLittleton
Reviews.Content: This eclectic little gem is the perfect place to stay if you like the Venice Beach ambience. When you step out the front door, you're on the Boardwalk, ten steps from the sand and right in the heart of all the fun. The rooms (ours included a kitchenette) are comfortable and spotlessly clean. The staff is friendly, knowledgeable, and incredibly helpful. Whether we needed a taxi, a restaurant recommendation, or a boogie board, they were delighted to make sure we were well taken care of. And all this at the best price we found anywhere in the area. It was a great experience on every level.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: erdbeerkern
Reviews.Content: fully recommend this hotel: nice rooms, friendly people, direct in the "venice-beach-live"; we stayed 3 nights and would definitly come again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place”
Reviews.Author: mmbb63
Reviews.Content: We (my husband and I and our 13 year old daughter) came to Venice Beach never having been before and immediately fell in love with the area as well as the hotel. The room was indeed small but having traveled in Europe, it wasn't anything we weren't used to. The staff was super friendly and helpful. Doors were looked at 9 PM and reopened at 9 AM so we felt very safe. Homeless folks in the area were harmless and never approached us. Plenty of inexpensive places to eat in the area and the kitchenette was a great thing to have. Free bottle of 2-buck Chuck in the room was a nice touch. Board walk and long walking path was perfect for an early morning jog. Will definitely come back here!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: LizzieT1
Reviews.Content: Great location - right on the beach front and sidewalk! Perfect for wandering up and down or just people watching. Just a few buildings down from the famous sidewalk cafe. Room lovely and airy with mini kitchen (fridge, hotplates, microwave), looked just as it does on their website. Did not have a car with me, so can't comment on the parking situation, but felt safe walking around at night, there was always lots of people walking about the main sidewalk. The staff were amazingly helpful and informative about the area and where to eat etc. Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “In the middle of it all”
Reviews.Author: TBegay
Reviews.Content: Location ,,location, location..that is what you get here. The rooms are quirky cramped and a bit shabby but so is Venice itself. You are in the middle of the action here...steps from a nice beach short walk to the canals. The people at the hotel will bend over backwards to make your stay better...free bikes,beach chairs wine and umbrellas...Venice is a bit seedy but I never felt unsafe. choose the top floor so you don't have noise ofpeople walking on your celing. Would stay here again if ever back in Venice...but Venice beach is not my style one full day here was enough for me

Reviews.Title: “Venice Beach is a perfect location for L.A. vacation!”
Reviews.Author: WOWAMYJO
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently returned from our eclectic experience on the Venice Beach boardwalk while staying at this hotel. We loved it. They didn't charge us for the two buck Chuck left in the room when they could have easily done so as most hotels do when you touch anything in their mini bar. It was so quaint. At night, the boardwalk does turn into a ghost town but I wouldn't say I felt unsafe. The door is locked so the vagrants don't wander in and that made me feel safer! The next time I'd request a fourth floor room so we don't hear the noise of those upstairs. We were in the back on the 3rd floor and could still see the ocean. It was so cool that we didn't need our fan and could keep the windows open to leave us very comfy. The staff and owner we so personable and we were wanting for nothing. Parking stinks but after we lost our place on the street, it was worth the $20.00 to park in a spot where you could drive in and out. If you are looking for cookie cutter white bread experience, this is not your place. If you are looking for an adventure and character, this definitely is the place to stay. The Culls Chicago IL

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: netio78
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed for two days. This hotel is very convenient because you can walk to restaurants, shops, and the beach etc. The beach was surprisingly good: it was clean and cool but not cold water. If you are a "people watcher" this is the place to come. Bring your walking shoes or rent a bike. The staff is very friendly and recommended a few places that were excellent. If are into high-end food, there is a small cluster of good restaurants about 7 blocks away. We are from the San Francisco Bay Area and this place reminded us of a cross between Berkeley/Santa Cruz/SantaRow (SJ). The hotel is clean and gives you the feeling of being in France . Everything is small but it is all you need as the room had a kitchenette! I would definately recommend a stay here for the great value for your money!

Reviews.Title: “Stay Out Of Venice”
Reviews.Author: WarriorOfRoadTrips
Reviews.Content: I got an ocean front room when I stayed here. While the inside of the room was very pretty, all exposed brick and lofty looking, and the staff were as helpful as they could be, I never once felt safe. There is no one there at night, and I saw homeless men walking down the main halls more than once. My room was low enough that if I'd left the shutters open anyone could look up into my room, thus making a ocean front room pointless since I never opened the blinds. Some of the windows didn't lock properly and could in theory be accessed by the adjoining rooftop of the building next door. I found a few bugs in the kitchenette. The washroom was drafty and cramped, and trying to have a shower in the claw foot tub was very annoying. While I would never stay here again, I also wouldn't stay in Venice Beach ever again either. It's wonderful to visit for the day, go on a Saturday and see the boardwalk in full swing, go to the canals, and Abbot Kinney, but really if you want to have a fun, safe vacation, don't go here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: reana
Reviews.Content: Just got back from an amzing trip to California, Nevada and Arizona. This was the first place we stayed for 3 nights and it is really good value for money. Our room was a non ocean view to the back of the building which was fine. The room was clean, spacious and well equipped. You can't beat the location, as it's directly on the boardwalk. The staff (Tom) were really helpful and were happy to give to give advice. Would recommend it to friends and family. Parking is the only problem, as you have to either pay for a space located a couple of minutes walk away (up $20 per day) or try and find free parking. Just make sure you move the car on a Monday/Tuesday between 10am-12 noon, as we got a ticket..... ($50). It's worth hiring bikes (boardwalk) and cycling to Santa Monica along the bike paths, loads to see.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem!!”
Reviews.Author: 2CITALL
Reviews.Content: This little hotel tucked into the "middle" of the boardwalk of Venice Beach is a hidden gem in a truly amazing area. Literally surrounded by shopping, restaurants, bar, bike paths and a most amazing beach. It has all you need for a wonderful beachside getaway. Teri the manager went above & beyond...assisting us with airport transfers, recommending restaurants, bars and bicycle rentals and even mapping out a walking tour of Venice. The oceanfront rooms are well worth it...you will see the most amazing sunsets!! The rooms are equipped with all you will need and the bottle of wine...such a well appreciated touch!! I hope to return for another stay at this "Hidden Gem"!!

Reviews.Title: “We are coming back !!!!”
Reviews.Author: julesSF8
Reviews.Content: Great location, great staff, comfortable room with a KITCHENETTE !!!!!!~ that is such a plus. Booked again for an Oct. trip. Will always stay here when in L.A.

Reviews.Title: “A gem on Venice Beach”
Reviews.Author: Nancyinminnesota
Reviews.Content: All the comforts of home plus more. So much to do and see around the immediate area. I am a woman and stayed by myself .I felt completely safe. The staff is extra helpful and friendly. I would definately stay at the Venice Beach and Suites again. The location is perfect and the price is so affordable. This is a gem.

Reviews.Title: “Great for singles or family”
Reviews.Author: huskertravelers
Reviews.Content: Our family of 2 adults and 3 children stayed at the largest suite on the top floor. A beautiful view of the beach and sunset! The kids loved walking around and going to the beach. The room was very warmly decorated and the staff was great too. Price was average. The only drawback was the parking. You had to walk a ways with your luggage.

Reviews.Title: “What the heck are these people talking about?”
Reviews.Author: chucolate
Reviews.Content: We booked this place after reading the amazing reviews here on this site. We stayed on the second floor. It was the most disgusting room/ dirty and small hotel I've ever been in. There were dirty stuff smeared on the wall and its very old place. And for the price low 100's I think I could have booked somewhere else better. The location was great, just a step out to the beach, but there were a lot of homeless folks around at night and gangster wannabes. We got there late evening and just stayed for the night and there's not much to do. And the room was really unconfortable as it was small and dirty. I'm really amazed with the reviews this place had. We came here with an infant.. not very idea place to stay with an infant either as the place is small and the elevator is tiny. And there were some people who were stoned outside our hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal and friendly”
Reviews.Author: The_Two_Brians
Reviews.Content: I had visited Venice Beach briefly when staying at Santa Monica in 1994, so to find such an ideal location for a holiday was wonderful. A friend and I stayed for 7 days from 2-9 October 2007. We were made very welcome and nothing was too much bother for the staff who were always helpful, patient and showed us a very warm welcome. The room was brilliant, the best of our three centre Holiday (San Francisco and New York being the other two). Having the beach so close, the sound of the sea at night and the palm trees to give some shade - it couldn't have been better. Restaurants and bars in the immediate area were good for eating and a two minute walk to the bus stop for buses to Santa Monica and beyond were well situtated. There's lots of free day time 'enterntainment' on the Boardwalk too! A wonderful relaxing place. Blue skies and temperatures in the low 80's all week. We shall return! Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, Funky Place with a Great Personality”
Reviews.Author: hatter603
Reviews.Content: We just got back from 2 nights at this hotel and can't say enough about it. Our room had a ocean view and was charming and clean as a whistle! We were on the fourth floor and had a full kitchen (small but had everything we would need). It had beautiful hardwood floors and a funky brick wall. The bathroom was tiny but the shower itself was better than the one I had at a Hilton in San Diego the week before. The gal in the office was very friendly and helped us find good places to eat and fun stuff to do. The boardwalk was amazing too. Lots of interesting jpeople to talk with. Of course, we are both old hippies so we fit right in. People were very mellow and fun to talk to. I would definitely recommend the hotel and Venice Beach. We can't wait to get back.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly staff, fun location - Lot of fun”
Reviews.Author: SleeplessinSTL
Reviews.Content: I was a first time traveler to LA and didn't know what to expect from Venice Beach. This hotel is right on the boardwalk and right next to the sand/ocean. There are a ton of shops for miles in front of the boardwalk with a lot of interesting things for sale/cool people to meet. People are very friendly. There are homeless on the boardwalk, but none were threatening. The hotel was older but in good shape and very clean. The beds were comfortable, and I had a free bottle of wine. The staff had my room available before the 3 PM check in, emailed me weather/surf reports, photo copied maps, recommended restaurants, and helped with taxis. Overall a really enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “over priced, and dated, staff very nice, but a lot of homeless outside”
Reviews.Author: bhoy029
Reviews.Content: it an old hotel, which i felt was over priced, not a lot happens in Venice now adays, it was like a ghost town come 9pm, only homeless people around. it was busy during the day, but there not many good places in venice now adays, i would try a differnt place to stay if i was going again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Danthewrestler
Reviews.Content: How anyone can write a bad review about Venice Beach Suites is beyond me. I stayed there for about 3 weeks in 2005 and the hotel played a major part in making my vacation the best I have ever had. The staff were so genuinely friendly and helpful, such good people. The apartment had everything I could have wanted and you will not find a better location. Granted the hotel is not 5* and the accomodation is basic, but you're not paying for 5*. You get a great bang for your buck. The place has what you need, its clean, safe and comfortable.....thats what counts. I will be returning to Venice Beach in 2008 and I will 100% most certainly be staying at Venice Beach Suites. Dan England

Reviews.Title: “A Treasure”
Reviews.Author: MTinAZ
Reviews.Content: This afternoon, my family I will be making our fourth trip to the Venice Beach Suites. We discovered it (actually our friends did) about 2 years ago. If we had the time and money, we would make the 6 hour trek from Phoenix more often! The hotel's location could not be better. It is right on the boardwalk (promenade) -- in fact, right in the heart of the action. The rooms overlooking the boardwalk (and beach/ocean) are more expensive, but worth the splurge in my opinion. (I have to admit there is a selfish side to me that wants to keep this a secret, so the rooms will more likely be available next time I want to book them!) The rooms are sufficiently clean and the kitchens are well-stocked. A couple of years ago, there were some minor repair issues, but the owners seem to be on top of things now. Besides the ideal location, the other wonderful thing about Venice Beach Suites is (are) the proprietors, or office staff or whatever they are. I just know that I have repeatedly interfaced with the same three people in person or on the phone, and all have been great. They go out of their way to accommodate their guests. Plus there are nice little perks, such as a bottle of wine in the room. We even got a follow-up thank you card after our first visit.
