I notice the vast majority of the reviews of this place have been very positive. There were a couple of negative reviews also, and I cannot help but wonder whether the reviewers knew what they were in for. I should point out that Venice (and the hotel) are probably not for everyone. This will not be your pristine Sheraton-on-a-quiet-family-oriented-beach experience. This is Venice Beach. It is crowded, especially on weekends, and parking spaces are at a premium. (The lot won't accommodate big vehicles, and you may have to drive a while before you find street parking. But once you park your car, you can relax and enjoy the rest of your stay on foot.) There are bums and loonies on the boardwalk and beach. Also entertainers, vendors, and people who dress funny. The stores are quirky, and sometimes risqué. Venice Beach is a little less clean than neighboring Santa Monica, and a lot less commercialized. (You'll find very few chain restaurants in Venice.) This is its appeal. I have not known it to be unsafe (I think the police crack down on locals who bother the tourists). But it's also not a sheltered slice of Leave-It-To-Beaver America. To summarize, Venice Beach is a funky, crowded, noisy adventure (at least from late morning to sunset). And Venice Beach Suites is a wonderful hotel run by wonderful people right in the center of all the fun.

Reviews.Title: “The right place”
Reviews.Author: ZombyWoof
Reviews.Content: We were 2 families from Denmark staying here. We loved the atmosphere, the staff, the location, the view and the small kitchen, where we made our own food for the first time in a month. This is far from luxury, but it has a lot of other advantages:-)

Reviews.Title: “Best in Venice”
Reviews.Author: samdogNY
Reviews.Content: Been to Cali 2x in past year.... Stayed in the VBSH BOTH times and LOVE the place.... First time was a shot in the dark and i loved it so much i made it a point to go back..... If you want straight-edge high end & pristine take a hike down to Manhattan Beach and you'll get the Hamptons west.... if you're into activity, life, and real people stay here .... the beach is at your doorstep as is music & art and people skateboarding, rollerblading, bike riding, walking and people just living the cali life.... Yes there are homeless people living on the boardwalk buts thats the nature of trhe business down there.... During the day they just blend in w/the crowds.... and at night I have never been bothered at all.... The beach does get quite and dark at night but thats b/c its the beach and theres not much else around except for lots of water! The staff is awesome.... tell you exact where to park on the street so walk the 2 blocks it's no big deal.... the bottle wine is a nice touch and the rooms are very nice.... you can just settle into your small apartment for a few days.... very relaxing.... def worth the rooms above the first floor so you get a view of the water/boardwalk....

Reviews.Title: “Great Location; Great Manager”
Reviews.Author: VaWingfoot
Reviews.Content: We were 3 groups of family members (aged 22 to 87 years old) and had 3 rooms here June 14-17, 2007. The beachfront location is great, but the hotel is very old, has a scary elevator and definitely needs sprucing up. The previous comment about the bathtubs and sinks was right on target. I stayed in Room 304 and had a great view looking south at the boardwalk/ocean, but you had to ignore all the ugly rooftops to see the view. Room 108 was large and had a more modern shower, but was inside the back door and had a lot of noise of people coming in and out the door. There was no view from this room. Room 207 was an OK size room with a ball-and-claw bathtub. It also had no view. They could improve this hotel significantly just by replacing the sheets, towels and bedspreads and adding a few coats of paint. Bigger bathroom sinks would also be a plus. The manager, Teri, was so friendly, informative and hospitable, that it was easy for us to ignore some of the hotel's shabbiness. Teri made our stay much more pleasant -- whatever her boss is paying her, he should triple it! All in all, we left feeling that, overall, it was a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Cheerful”
Reviews.Author: everlovin
Reviews.Content: Dublin Ireland....I stayed here with my 4 yr old son for 4 nights based on tripadvisors reviews and Im glad I did.We didnt have a car and found we were able to travel very easily on public transport which is right by the hotel,sometimes not returning till late and we were never in fear or afraid who was around or the "dodgy" looking characters that live on the beach.The kitchenette is well stocked with dishes,fridge,stove top and microwave...enough to cook a meal if you so wished.The staff were very friendly and most helpful.It was great staying in a place where the first thing you dont hear is knocking on your door to have it cleaned or the noise of a vacume cleaner outside.I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants great value for money and a great location...I mean there arent many hotels where you step out the front door onto the boardwalk and a few steps further your on the beach.Hope to get back again soon

HotelInfo.Name: Venice Beach Suites & Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 1305 Ocean Front Walk, Los Angeles, CA 90291
